reviews.review_text: Its like half arena shooter half Tony Hawk Pro Skater

Tribes Ascend gets the Game Of The Year reward and a bunch of other good stuff!  Then Smite comes along...  Hi-Rez decides to work on Smite than Tribes Ascend   Why?  $$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$   How dead did the game become?  Well, there were no forums, no updates, no customer support... (when you did contact customer support they referred to the game as smite)  The only thing you could do is download the game.   Why not work on Tribes Ascend instead?  Tribes Ascend got Game Of the Year. And what did Smite win? Money?   Has HiRez done something like this before?  Yes. An even older game (but made with the same engine) called Global Agenda is more abandonded than Tribes Ascend. That game is an MMORPG, like Smite (hint hint)   Then, after constant demands from the remnants of the Tribes Ascend community (mostly GOTY edition owners, but also those who liked the game a lot and whose game didn't stop working), HiRez comes out with the 'out of the blue' update!   First off, let's make the original Tribes games free!  Too bad no one liked them, but yay!   Next, let's change the liked class system with a system from the older games: light, medium, and heavy.  Noooo! why would you simplify the class system (which actually overcomplicated it. Now there are a bunch of restrictions, like you cant cloak with the sniper rifle.)   We did this by popular demand.  What popular demand? Those who migrated to Smite or something?   Oh, and all that money you spent on the GOTY edition and all of that gold/silver you used to buy weapons? We refunded it all back.  Great, real great... Now I need to find the weapons I bought before... And they removed GOTY edition? why?   We also removed a bunch of boring weapons and kept the OP ones  Why? My loadouts consisted mostly of that!!!   We also added something called the 'all weapons pack'  Oh, I see now... A variant of the P2W GOTY edition pack without the loadout, class, and perk unlock (which were removed or changed to make GOTY edition not much more than all weapons)   We also added 2 new maps from previous Tribes games  Yay, although the previous games weren't that good...   Thank you for playing Tribes Ascend, hope you enjoy the new Tribes, have a nice day, blablabla outro stuff  Really? Really?  NOW!  Tribes Ascend has reverted to the remnant player community it was after the shutdown. With only a few servers with actual players, Tribes Ascend has only gone down. Nice job, HiRez.

Played it.  Thought it was supposed to be Hi-Rez's free version of Advanced Warfare.  9/10. Would be 10 if it wasn't for Hi Rez dumping it. And The graphics (OK)   15/08/2015 (Edited)  Have they actually come back? Has Hi-Rez come back???

It's good again guys.  Quick Pro-Con Lost  PRO: -The movement. I mean god damn, does it put games like Titianfall and the latest cawadoody entry to shame. The entire game is played with an exo-suit that makes you feel like you've got an ACME rocket-powered skatboard welded to your feet at all times. With the hilly structure of nearly all of the maps, it's like the worlds most dangerous skate park - but with guns and Capture the Flag.  -The weapons. Don't expect too many traditional pew pews in Tribes. This game is fought primarily with high-velocity explosive frisbees. Spinfusors are the name of the game, and learning to use one is easy, but eyeballing the trajectory, distance, and speed of your enemy as they go screaming across the map and scoring a hit is a ♥♥♥♥♥ to master. Weapon variety is enough to keep you happy, and each one has it's own little purpose.  -The classes. Old Tribes players will disticntly remember nine in total, but with recent updates it's been shaved down to three; light, medium, and heavy. Don't worry, this is probably my favorite new feature, as it allows more creativity in creating them. Classes are simple, light means go fast, heavy means big armor, and medium is a balance between the two. With the new additions, you can really carve out your niche in the match. Want to have some heavy offensive ordinance AND be able to deploy a turret now? You can. Want to carry a crossbow and a Jackal at the same time? No more class restriction on that. Chaingun AND Heavy spinfusor AND Fractal Grenade? Yep, that too. The sky's the limit.  -The graphics. Not on par with a triple-A 2016 release but still really pretty if you crank everything up to max, and can still be set low enough to play on a toaster. The gameplay is the focus here.  -It's free. What more could you want?  SO-SO -Cannot be played through Steam, so your favorite dank meme name is a no-go. -Serves can get a bit underpopulated, but that's not bad in my opinion becaue you see a few famailiar faces from time to time.   CON: -Learning curve is a bit frusturating. 20 hours in and I'm still getting my behind kicked. -May be dead as a doornail in a year or two. -I can't think of anythig else.

It's pretty good after you unlock your first two classes, but before that (and even after), the game is extremely hard to master, as everyone else has super upgraded weapons, perks and other stuff. Vehicles can be acquired by spending 'XP' earned in matches (XP resets every match). This game is good enough that I still play it, but IMO, the match-making should be better. I keep being set into games that have people that are 20 or something ranks ahead of me.  Good points:  -JETPACKS!  -Unique Ski mechanic that lets you fly through the map barely touching the ground.  -Great inertia/velocity physics  -Requires skill  -Recent update made things cheaper  -Interesting weapons  Bad points:  -Dwindling population  -Terrible, if any, matchmaking  -Requires skill  -Things are still pricy  -Lack of support from the devs (they've moved on).  Misc. points:  -There are almost no hitscan weapons, meaning you have to lead your shots and use your brain to calculate/anticipate/predict where your enemy will be by the time your shot reaches them.  -No ADS. It's either zoom or hipfire, much like Halo.  -If you don't ski and/or use your jetpack, and play this like CoD or Battlefield, you're gonna be dead quick.  -The maps are large, so you'll need to use your enhanced movement to get around quicker.  tl:dr: Much better than Smite, although the developer has abandoned the game.

Tribes Ascend is one of my all time favorite games. It may have all the evils of a FTP but it is still an excellent game. Few things can match up to the feeling of a high speed flag grab, or the satisfaction of a blue plate special. The weapons have enough variety to give everyone something to suit their playstyle, and each holds its own key to mastery. Though not as flexible as mumble or teamspeak, the in game quick-chat system works well to connect players together. The games classes are all unique and fun and give a great variety of ways to play. No class has ever been OP it has always been the weapons. From the thumper to the faze rifles to the MIRV, there has always been a weapon that HiRez has milked for cash; This is the primary source of frustration in the game. The game has strategy speed and skill requirements of any good shooter and though difficult to aproach can quickly become a favorite. I personally do not own the GOTY edition so I am not sure if it levels the playing feild or effects matches that much. Tribes Ascend: Even with its shortcomings and faults is an amazing game and I hope to see a sequel in the near future.

Okay everyone, time to come back to Tribes! The game is fantastic and provides a fast-paced (and I mean fast), objective-based, team-oriented FPS.  The grind is still tough to unlock all the items (without spending $$$), but what you start off with is still fun to use and competitive in-game. You should spend your first few hours in the game trying to become an expert with your trusty spinfusor anyway.  New players, do the skiing tutorial if nothing else (it takes 5 minutes) just to get the basics of skiing down. It is an essential part of the game and is one of the main features that makes this game so fun and addictive.  Give it a shot if you've never played. And if you abandoned the game a while ago, it's time to come back!

A game usually lasts 20 minutes to complete and usually dosent give you much experience.  3: It requires a HiRez account to play and that always takes time to get started. I believe that tribes ascend is a wonderful game. I've tested it on an old laptop with a i5 3210m CPU with Intel HD 4000 graphics and found myself playing the game at around 30fps, with some drops to around 20fps on the odd occasion and on medium graphical settings. This shows the game has been well optimised for lower end computers and can be playable for many people who own either a high or low end PC or laptop.  I like the fast paced game movement style, really gets me tired of the normal walking speed on games like battlefield, COD and other first person shooters that are similer. I like the variety of classes and weapons and although you can pay to claim weapons at an early stage, I think that earning them gives you proudness over what you have achieved. I highly recommend this game to all that enjoy zipping around and blasting men in metal suits out of the sky above you and think that although this game has been around for a long time, it still claims a place in the best PC games out there.

This game is by far one of my favourites. You can move so fast and it is so skill based that even with the weapons you can buy (which you can earn in game) don't make it pay to win. Sadly this game was dropped by it's devs and has lost a lot of it's activity but I still think it remains a fun game and there is no reason not to try it out.

An excellent reboot of a loved classic. It stays true to the Tribes look and feel, and is a blast to play.  I've heard lots of friends and colleagues bash the game for an (apparently) pay-to-win structure. This is simply not the case. Upgrades do take time to earn (but you'll get there if you simply play the game). A good number of the upgrades, in fact, make the game harder to play (from my perspective anyhow). In that way the game is as balanced as it can be; it is an FPS after all, so you need more than just a meta-game proficiency to be any good. Reaction time and motion prediction are skills that do you well here, this ain't no point-and-click adventure (MOBA players stay away; I dont want your filth in or around anything that I love :D )  The visuals in this game are excellent as well. Like I've said before, it stays true to the Tribes look and feel, but pushes the envelope further than it has ever been.

90% of the games devolve into a Juggernaut chucking a fusion grenade into your generator room, killing everone in the room, destroying your defences. Not that it matters, since the Pathfinders can just skid right through the horrible inaccurate turrets and steal your flag. This problem could be solved if your Juggernauts actually placed some shields around your flag, but this will never happen because they are too busy sitting on a cliffside, firing mortars at the enemy.   AWESOME concepts, awesome style, lots of classes and weapon/equipment combos; not so good balancing. For free, I can't argue much, and I _could_ argue that this is pay-to-win, but this isn't even about winning. It's just tedious to keep digging out the guy launching fusion grenades into your curiously indefensible gen room. One would think that killing the generator would be a big thing that your team should love you for, but the borderline useless turrets and lack of incentive for teamwork make the act mundane.  The King of the Hill mode is better, but all it involves is sliding around the map in circles.   The sliding and jetpack idea is great, but it seems very underutilized.

Why don't you already own this?  This is a competitive, free-to-play, balanced, fast paced (the real fast, not CoD crap) shooter. The graphics are both functional and formative, simultaneously throwing stunning graphics at the user, whilst still being simple enough for a competitive game. except bloom. turn that off.  The game features an EXTREMELY high skill ceiling, and all of the starter equipment is more or less a sidegrade to the equipment you can purchase. Speaking of, with the exception of skins (and possibly voice packs) the entire game can be played for free. No FUNCTIONAL item in the game is Premium only, and while the grind will take a while, you can obtain all weapons, classes and perks as a free player. This keeps the game as balanced as possible, which is critical in competitive play.  Finally, the game itself is a blast to play, from nailing a perfect 300kp/h flag grab, to sniping out said flag carrier across the map just as he's about to cap, this game scores a 9.8/10.

For a free to play (with microtransactions, mind you) game, this takes the cake of making my experience a living N00B hell.  First off, this game requires TIME and PATIENCE. If you want to get kills, either get a controller for your PC or be a part of the TaZe clan. Out of every FPS experience I have had, Tribes: Ascend has been the only one that has put difficulty to the test in terms of Deathmatch and Domination.  Second, what I don't like much about Tribes: Ascend is the fact that microtransactions definitely outweigh the F2P set of guns and other secondary material. I, a F2P gamer by heart, am not financially or mentally ready to spend $40 to pay for a game that's like Halo but MMO and extremely difficult to play. And in knowing that, I don't put money into it and usually wait for my slow addiction to come back and make me play Deathmatch one. last. time. before eventually I slam on my keys and uninstall it.  However, I do recommend this game. It's originality with Gameplay paired up with its great but durable graphics, makes me smile to myself at the perfection put into Tribes: Ascend. The explosions, the bullets crossing through the air, the respawning animation, all makes me wonder whether this will come to console and allow me an easier go using the L1 key on PS3 to aim down sights. Sick of your classic FPS such as Call of Duty or your classic Counter Strike?.....  Tribes: Ascend offers one of the most addictive and interesting styles of FPS in the history of FPS. It adds one element that many shooters neglect too make it watered down and easier to play. This is what they call 'skiing' or sliding in another sense, you can make yourself frictionless, and in the world of maps that have hills and slopes, combining this with your jetpack you can be sure to run into some pretty fast paced combat. The highlight of this ability comes too reality when you play CTF (capture the flag) where you have roles such as the flag capper or the flag chaser.  As a player of the old Tribes games, from memory I remember playing it browser based at one point but this was a long time ago and I can only slightly recall this. But I was extremely hooked and wouldn't stop playing it at all, it was just one of those games you get addicted too.  This game takes some time to get used to, so a suggestion is to practise in your own time by yourself on the bots and literally just do things over and over again until you get the hang of the dynamic play style such as things with your speed, gun types, projection and most importantly timing.  Sad to say though that it's hard to find a reasonable community to play with due to the lack of auidence this game now recieves. Nevertheless: Doesn't change the fact it's a fun game if you do happen too.
I loved it, spent hours messing around with friends, if you are a casual gamer, I think you will enjoy it

This ain't your daddy's fps... well, it might be if your pappy was a boss and played Tribes back in the day.   Forget those shooters with heart rate sensors, tiger print painted rifles, and 'realistic' combat. On a scale of one to ten, those are ♥♥♥♥ when compared to the brilliance which is Tribes. You ever try to kill an enemy with a single shot while travelling through the air at 150 mph while he tries to do the same to you? Didn't think so. You were probably too busy trying to figure out what nametag was the most swag.  Reward yourself with a faster shooter. A better shooter. A thinking person's shooter. Yeah, your first foray into the battle will not be pretty. You will die. Why? Cause your poor brain has never been subject to what appears to be a complete cluster♥♥♥♥. Stick with it. You might get an assist, maybe a kill. And you'll like it. Why? Cause that ♥♥♥♥ took skill. And once you get your first taste of that, you'll be hooked.  So do yourself a favor. Get Tribes: Ascend now.

Very fun game. Very fast paced but easy to learn. The basic premise is the ability to make yourself frictionless and 'ski' across the battlefield at 100+ kph. At it's core, Tribes is a pretty average sci-fi FPS, but with the ski mechanic the entire dynamic of the game changes, transforming a boring shootout into something more akin to a car chase across the large maps. The general feel of the game reminds me alot of the old Blood Gulch Halo 1 multiplayer.   Another refreshing thing about this game was the absence of pay-to-win microtransactions and such. Every class and gun in the game can be unlocked just by gathering experience in-game (as well as with purchasable gold). It makes you want to support the devs, unlike a lot of other similar MP games.  Anyhow, if shooters are your thing, definitely try this one out. It's free, it has a great community and addicting gameplay. Highly reccomend. See you in game.

Hitting a target with a projectile is the most basic goal in every shooter, but Tribes: Ascend might make it the most satisfying. Not because it sounds awesome, or because the guns make you feel powerful (though they do), but because scoring a hit takes a unique set of skills. The movement system in Tribes makes every battlefield into a playground, where good players can soar above the competition – both in terms of score and verticality. Tribes feels like a breath of fresh air for the shooter genre, and is quite possibly the best free-to-play game to date.

Before launch, this game had me really excited, even became a 'VIP' contributor (before this game hit steam +150 hours). It was tribes, but it didnt feel like tribes that much. The vast amount of automatic weapons was just mindblowing, in a bad way. It was like the devs was trying to make CoD on jetpacks. Some complained and some gave good feedback about various aspects of the game, but the devs just didn't listen. Even though the feedback was given by veteran tribes players! And now it seems like the game has been left to rot.  It feels like a good genre has been touched by something foul and tainted.  You might enjoy it, if you haven't played any other tribes games. If you have played tribes 2 or T:V, you might enjoy it for awhile, but in the end, it won't feel like tribes.

The game will always have a special place in my heart for what it offered me in 44 ranks and 767.4 hours. Sadly not a single value of those will ever go up for me.  Some may really like the changes the devs made, and others, like me, despise it because of how much flavor they removed from the game. I don't think merging guns and classes (not to mention a lot of nerfing) was the right way to bring tribes back to life.  If you're new you may like it, despite the even larger learning curve and salty community, if you're a returning vet, prepare for a slap to the face.
While it may be true Hi rez has fixed the game in recent years, this game is dead. I hate to say it, as it was one of my favourite games made by them.

Having played this a long time after the early 2012 hype, I can say that I see why people enjoyed this game - and why they left it. Of all the F2P games out there, the system in place here feels the most abrasive. So we essentially have a fast paced and highly competitive shooter (at least, on paper) with a unique concept, but we need to 'unlock' classes and weapons? I haven't played any of the other Tribes games, but even so I felt like I was playing a game that is a mere shell of its potential - and seeing how the developer outright abandoned it for a soulless MOBA cashgrab, I don't see it ever changing. The worst part about this game is that there are some genuinely fun and well designed parts when you get past the layers of cash shops and leveling systems, much like a puppy trapped in a sewer. It's heartbreaking, and its why I can't even recommend giving it a small trial.

What once was a fun game with some amusing things, like the OP perk combinations that were possible, has been dumbed down to what I would consider a low-blow to the Tribes series in general. Now that you can buy all the weapons and that in one incredibly cheap pack (which is nice, I must admit) the game feels like it's been rolled back to a beta-like stage. Should all the things that made this game very much enjoyable come back, I'll change my review.

Tribes Ascend was an awesome game. I was playing it long before it made it's way onto steam but sadly Hi-Rez has decided to quit updating it in favor of Smite as I assume they figured they can make more money off that game instead. Although this game was free to play or as some say 'Pay 2 Win' I'd have to disagree with the later part as the game required a good bit of fps skill to play and someone that just bought all the equipment could still be stomped on by a more skilled player.  But with the game long out of date and less than 150 players active I'll have to sadly say I would not recommend trying it out now as you would have missed the 'glory days'

Basically a futuristic competative FPS with huge open maps and everyone on skis. Its a FTP + microtransaction driven game and playable without those. Its a fairly unique take on the genre, with a variety of classes each with their own use. The game's graphics aren't that good so it runs fine.  The problem is that the dev has basically abandoned the game in favor of their new FTP moba. There's a modest score of not-well-balanced maps and some of the classes can be frustratingly imbalanced on some maps over others depending on microtransacted equipment (which would otherwise take a fair amount of time to grind out).  Don't play it. There are plenty of other paid FPS games you could purchase and get more out of, unless you're craving something Sci-fi in your competative FPS or have an empty wallet.

i have played all the previous tribes games. and this one (by far) is the most simplistic and dumbed down version. There is almost no stategy or teamwork left in the series. it is all about aiming and shooting, and there are hundreds of more interesting games that have the same depth. yes there are jetpacks, skiing and slow projectile weapons, but none of benefits of mastering them, because the only way victory is just who is better at aiming. no teamwork, no strategy, and no depth.   google 'tribes 2 trailer' for a small and simplistic example of the strategy that used to be required. even from over a decade ago with sucky graphics, the gameplay exceeded tribes ascend by far.

I Really hate to see games that have so much potential and fall flat on its face. Don't get me wrong, I like the idea for this game, I really do. And for a while that game worked and had a big following, But Hi-Rez have completely ruined there own game in this case. First of all, the graphics feel like last gen graphics (Even on max settings) which isn't good seeing as how the game is only a year old, next you have bad texture pop in, lag and environmental glitches. All of which could have easily been fixed with patches and routine updates, but Hi-Rez have stopped updates for this game to focus on SMITE (Ironically, its suffering the same fate as Tribes: Ascend). But if you're willing to look past the bad graphics (Gameplay over Graphics) the game does work, skiing, vehicles, jetpacks etc. work like they are supposed to, however trying to get accustomed to using them well in a game is impossible, because the community of new players is dead, leaving only Tribes veterans, that will wipe the floor with you giving you virtually no chance to improve at your own pace. and to make matters worse, the training section is a joke, they have a few options, basic skiing, free roam, practice with bots (F.Y.I. the training with bots isn't a full match like you'd think, its just the bots running back and forth in set direction or not moving around at all) or watching youtube videos explaining the classes. To me that is just lazy. And even thought they have servers of novices only, nothing stops a level 32 veteran from connecting to the server and demolishing all the level 1-7 novices; once again stopping all progress to get better at your own pace. All in all, don't get this game, it was great at one point but unfortunately we are all a year too late from it heyday. the only way I could recommend this game is if you're a tribes veteran, which most of us are not

Don't get me wrong, this game is really fun, its a nice new takes on fps games, its fun. But theres some problems that I just can't look past. The Thumper is rediculously overpowered. It isn't even funny, noobs come inwith a weapon that can decimate a vetern squad. It's sad.The spinfuser isnt much better, but atleast you have to aim to a certain extent. The vehicles arent nearly as awesome as Id expect them to be. I can take a tank down no problem as a juggernaut, and its so damn expensive. Shrikes aren't any better. Grav cycles aren't terrible, they're cheap, go fast, and do plenty of pewpews, but they might as well be made from wet paper. Generator room camping is quite the problem, Ive had it where 3-4 people fly into my gen room, and hold it for the entire round, crippling my teams ability to attack/defend. The issue here is that theres too much cover inside of the generator room, the enemy can use it just as well as allies. Of course, it's been a good year since I've played this, and if its changed, I'll go ahead and update this.

It was a good game, but it's changed a lot since last I played, it was fine how it was before aside from the FPS drops every now and then, I mean come on, if it's only got one minor problem don't ♥♥♥♥ing reskin it and crap it out like 'WE FIXED IT' (though you didn't cause the FPS is still ♥♥♥♥♥), when I came back I noticed that I had only the starting weapons, and the starting amount of XP, all of the XP I earned by playing this laggy as hell game, with only a handful of good players that would only be on my team half the time, all of the crap I unlocked with said XP, was gone, and I seem to recall being level 16, almost level 17, with around 180,000 XP give or take, but when I came back I was only ♥♥♥♥ing level 6, all of the classes were changed to have 'default' loadouts that were just named 'loadout 1' 'loadout 2' 'loadout 3' and so and and so forth, pretty much forcing you to take the time that you could be spending playing the game and possibly having fun to look at all the weapons for each class (light, medium, and heavy, by the way) and make and rename each ♥♥♥♥ing loadout yourself, it was much better when the loadouts were already there, made and named, I could just choose a class and choose a loadout like for example I choose light class, I could choose sniper, infiltrator, assassin, or with medium, there was soldier, and engineer, and a few others (I haven't memorized all of the classes), there was brute in heavy, I can't remember the name of the other heavy class I used, but my point is, they didn't need to alter the classes, it was (almost) perfectly fine the way it was! the only thing that needed fixing was whatever was causing the random lag spikes that could ruin a perfectly good game!  TL;DR it was good, they changed it too much, now it sucks balls, and I hope whoever thought the changes were a good idea steps on a very sharp and pointy lego.
